name: Endesa
membership:
Eurelectric, EDSO, WindEurope, FORATOM, EFET, CEOE, etc. 
National experts are members of these associations.
goal:
Endesa is the leading company in the Spanish electricity sector and the second largest operator in the Portuguese electricity market.Our core business is the generation, distribution and sale of electricity. We are also a major operator in the natural gas sector and we provide other energy-related services.
Our business activity is carried out mainly in the Spanish and Portuguese markets. We also sell electricity and gas in other European markets, as well as value-added products and services (VAPS) related to our main business areas.
Our company is committed to spreading a more sustainable energy culture and we are engaged in actively contributing towards building a smarter energy future.
We strive to be at the forefront of the technological transformation that has changed the face of the energy industry. All this is made possible by our solid industrial standing and the added strength of belonging to the Enel Group, a large multinational group that we joined during the first quarter of 2009.
Enel Group, which owns 70.1% of Endesa, is a multinational energy company and a leading integrated operator in the global electricity and gas markets, with a particular focus on European and Latin American markets.
At Endesa we now have over 10,000 employees and we provide services to 11 million customers.
interests: Borders and Security, Budget, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Competition, Consumers, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Energy, Environment, External Relations, International co-operation and development, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport
